name: open-in-external-terminal
description: An extension to open files or directories in the external (system) terminal.

open-in-external-terminal.preferredTermi.description: The executable path or command for your terminal (e.g., 'wt.exe', 'xterm'). Leave empty for system default.

open-in-external-terminal.additionalArgs.description: Arguments to pass to the terminal executable.

open-in-external-terminal.interpreterMap.markdownDescription:
Map file extensions to specific interpreters. 

Examples:
- `{".py": "python"}` executes `python file.py`
- `{".js": "/usr/bin/node"}` executes `/usr/bin/node file.js`

**Note:** Mappings defined here take precedence over `executableExtensions`.

open-in-external-terminal.executableExte.description: List of file extensions that should be executed directly by the OS. Ignored if the extension is found in 'interpreterMappings'.

open-in-external-terminal.showNotificati.description: Show a notification when opening the terminal.

open-in-external-terminal.logLevel.description: Logging level for the output channel.

open-in-external-terminal.a_hotkeyHelper.markdownDescription:
⬇️ **[Click here to Configure Keyboard Shortcut](command:workbench.action.openGlobalKeybindings?%22extension.openInExternalTerminal%22)** 

VS Code manages hotkeys separately from settings. Click the link above to assign a key (like `F5` or `Ctrl+Alt+T`) to this extension.
open-in-external-terminal.a_hotkeyHelper.description: Helper link to open Keybindings menu
